page.title: 14YOUTH HOSTEL
page.content: THERE IS A SMALL YOUTH HOSTEL ON RAASAY CALLED "THE ALAN EVANS MEMORIAL HOSTEL".IT IS NAMED AFTER ALAN EVANS WHO DIED IN 1967 AND DONATED THE BUILDING THEN KNOWN AS CREACHAN LODGE TO THE YOUTH HOSTEL ASSOCIATION.AFTER RENOVATION IT WAS RE-OPENED IN MAY 1982. IT HAS ROOM FOR 16 FEMALES AND 20 MALES.THE MALE DORMATORY IS A HUT JUST OUTSIDE ON THE HILL. IT IS SITUATED ON A BEAUTIFUL SITE OVER LOOKING THE SOUND OF RAASAY AND SKYE. THE PRESENT WARDEN IS MRS PATERSON,A RETIRED TEACHER FROM FIFE.THE HOSTEL IS ONLY OPEN FROM MAY TO SEPTEMBER.
